{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3031089,"name":"John Fogarty","username":"JohnFogarty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/johnfogarty/{size}/267052_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-27T16:27:04.822Z","cooked":"

We are attempting to automate our climber sequence to make the robot operate more efficiently during the final part of the match.

Our first approach is to make the climb sequence happen using timing. We have sensors… CANCoders and the FalconFX encoders we can use too but one step at a time… because we can’t seem to even get timing to work correctly.

We have setpoints we need to command our climber arm and climber telescoping poles to in order to perform our climb sequence.

I’m trying to do a similar approach Spectrum in that I execute the first command immediately and then in a parallel command group I execute a wait and then the 2nd step.

In reality for some reason this command runs on the robot and waits the 5 seconds before running both actions at the same time.

I’ve also tried to make a SequentialCommandGroup command that simply runs the sequence of commands one step at a time with wait commands in between and this also does not work correctly. The instant commands run at the same time after a delay.

I know we have not got the ideal approach in a lot of what we are doing but I don’t understand why my sequential commands do not work in either approach. We can get sequential actions to work fine in autonomous…

RapidReact2022/ClimberCommands.java at main · MAikenMagic1102/RapidReact2022 (github.com)

Infrared-2022/ClimberCommands.java at main · Spectrum3847/Infrared-2022 (github.com)

I’m a little confused as to why you’re composing the commands the way you are.

Here’s an example of our climber sequence that fires fine from teleop and auto.

It’s a bit different in style than what you guys have produced, but maybe it will offer some bright insight as to what may be going on with yours.

We tried that exact same method first and it also did not work.

So before you did your command composition as InstantCommands you had them as normal commands in sequential groups, and that didn’t work?

Instead of composing an InstantCommand.andThen(Wait(5))), why not simplify the composition a bit and make the original command do it’s thing and not finish until the 5 seconds are up? That sort of change is what I was thinking.

It looks to me as if your command (retractPoles → ClimberPolesToSetpoint) is merely recording the setpoint in a member variable, but the new set point is not acted upon until the default command kicks back in and calls ClimberOpenLoop.
